paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on two distinct protein-truncating BRCA2 mutations associated with early-onset prostate cancer.

patients.demographics: Caucasian, diagnosed with prostate cancer before age 55

individual_records.evidence_sentence: One of these mutations was a 5-bp deletion (4625_4629delACATT) and the other was a 2-bp deletion (4074_4075delGT), both located in exon 11.
One of these mutations was a 5-bp deletion (4625_4629delACATT) and the other was a 2-bp deletion (4074_4075delGT), both located in exon 11.

functional_data.summary: Both mutations are protein-truncating and associated with early-onset prostate cancer.

variants.segregation_data: Both mutations were detected in Caucasian patients with prostate cancer.
variants.additional_notes: The estimated cumulative risk of prostate cancer to age 55 years in Caucasian men due to carrying a disease-associated BRCA2 mutation is about 1.1%.
key_quotes: Results suggest that protein-truncating BRCA2 mutations confer an elevated RR of early-onset prostate cancer.
The estimated cumulative risk (i.e. penetrance) of prostate cancer to age 55 years in Caucasian men due to carrying a disease-associated BRCA2 mutation is about 1.1%.

tables_processed.table_caption: Characteristics of the two prostate cancer patients with protein-truncating BRCA2 mutations.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
